name: Tribal Registry
objective: To develop and maintain a national tribal sex offender registry and a tribal protection order registry containing civil and criminal orders of protection issued by Indian tribes and participating jurisdictions.
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals
Native American Organizations (includes Indian groups, cooperatives, corporations, partnerships, associations)
categories: Law, Justice, and Legal Services - Tribal Independence and Autonomy

authorizations.text: 905(b), Violence Against Women and Department of Justice Reauthorization Act of 2005, Title IX. 28 Stat. 534. Pub. L. 109, 162.

rules_regulations: Program solicitations can be found at https://www.justice.gov/ovw/how-to-apply-for-ovw-funding. Recipients must comply with the current version of the DOJ Financial Grants Management Guide found at https://www.justice.gov/ovw/grant-management.

pons.pon: Increase Tribal Self-Governance and Decision-Making Authority
